reasoning: # Use QF_UF and QF_LIA rules with simple integer constraints to model the scheduling problem. The SMT-LIB program should include the following constraints: # A must be executed by processor C1 P_A <= P_C1 * 2; # Assign tasks to processors based on their capabilities # B must be executed by processor C2 P_B <= P_C2 * 3; # Assign tasks to processors based on their capabilities # Check if the assignment satisfies all constraints
program:
# SMT-LIB code
# Define the process types
set-logic QF_UF
set-logic QF_LIA
# Declare the processes and their capabilities
declare-const P_A : process (input : integer) -> integer;
declare-const P_B : process (input : integer) -> integer;
assert P_A >= 0; # A must be non-negative
assert P_B >= 0; # B must be non-negative
# Declare the processors and their capacities
declare-const P_C1 : processor (capacity : integer) -> boolean;
declare-const P_C2 : processor (capacity : integer) -> boolean;
assert P_C1 >= 2; # C1 must have at least two processes
assert P_C2 >= 3; # C2 must have at least three processes
